channel.title: ü¶â Biiraiverse Wiki on
channel.description: Recent content in ü¶â Biiraiverse Wiki on

item.title: Agriculture
item.description: Agriculture emerged in at least three distinct places: these are the known as the “cradles of civilization”. One was the southwestern corner of [[notes/Continent D|Continent D]], one was the northernmost point of [[notes/Continent A|Continent A]], and the third was the southern portion of [[notes/Continent E|Continent E]].

item.title: Biirai (language)
item.description: Biirai is a [[notes/Biiraic languages|Biiraic language]]. Phonology Consonants Labial Coronal Palatal Velar Stop p b t d k g Nasal m n Affricate dz Fricative s Flap …æ <r> Approximant j w Vowels Front Central Back High i iÀê <ii> u uÀê <uu> Low a aÀê <aa> Phonetically, the vowels are usually produced more centrally than the phonemic chart indicates, i.

item.title: Biirai (people)
item.description: The Biirai are an ethnic group who inhabit the interior desert of [[notes/Continent A|Continent A]]. They speak various [[notes/Biiraic languages|Biiraic languages]].

item.title: Biiraic languages
item.description: The Biiraic languages are a family of languages spoken in the interior desert of [[notes/Continent A|Continent A]]. The best known of these languages (and the only one described thus far) is [[notes/Biirai (language)|Biirai]], from which the family takes its name.

item.title: Biiraiverse Fanfiction Contest
item.description: To celebrate the 50th livestream on our channel,1 we’d like to give the talented members of our community an opportunity to have a more active hand in shaping the lore of the Biiraiverse.

item.title: Continent A
item.description: ![[notes/images/continent-a.png]] Regions Southern Range ([[notes/Sotonic]], many more) Western Range Interior ([[notes/Biiraic languages|Biiraic]])¬† Hot Desert¬† Hot Steppe West Coast Hot Desert (foggy) Hot Steppe (West) (foggy) Tropical Savannah Tropical Monsoon?

item.description: ![[notes/images/continent-c.png]] Regions Northern ([[notes/Sakrat languages|Sakrat]], [[notes/Sasyut|Sasyut]], maybe others) Tropical Savannah Tropical Monsoon Tropical Rainforest Subtropical Highland? Southern (?) Tropical Rainforest Tropical Monsoon Tropical Rainforest Subtropical Highland?

Northern Archipelago ([[notes/Sakrat languages|Sakrat]]) Tropical Monsoon Tropical Rainforest Southern (?

item.title: Continent E
item.description: ![[notes/images/continent-e.png]] Regions Western Continent E The western coast of Continent E is dominated by speakers of [[notes/Qal languages|Qal languages]]. It contains the following climate zones:

item.title: Geography
item.description: The geography of the Biiraiverse is only partially described. We are aware of five continents: [[Continent A]] [[notes/Continent B|Continent B]] [[Continent C]] [[Continent D]] [[notes/Continent E|Continent E]] Climate zones !

item.title: History
item.description: The history of the Biiraiverse is not yet well described. Topics to explore: The emergence of [[notes/Agriculture|agriculture]] The [[notes/Tarunian exchange|Tarunian exchange]]

item.title: Justamija Qal
item.description: Justamija Qal was a [[notes/Qal languages|Qal language]] spoken on [[notes/Continent E|Continent E]].

item.title: Kra Nzlor
item.description: Kra Nzlor is a [[notes/Sakrat languages|Sakrat language]].

item.title: Languages
item.description: The languages of the Biiraiverse are divided into several primary language families. So far, the following families have been described:

item.title: Lenethailef
item.description: Lenethailef is a [[notes/Qal languages|Qal language]] spoken in the southwestern coastal regions of [[notes/Continent E|Continent E]]. It emerged as a distinct language around 1100 BP.

item.title: My«ênh
item.description: My«ênh is a [[notes/Sakrat languages|Sakrat language]].

item.title: Ndulh
item.description: The ndulh ([[Proto-Eastern Mbaljok]] *n…ó…Ø é) a mammal used as a beast of burden like a horse. The ndulh is native to [[notes/Continent E|Continent E]].

item.title: Pan-Sakrat naming practices
item.description: Names in the [[notes/Sakrat languages|Sakrat languages]] are almost always composed of exactly two morphemes. These bimorphemic names are interpreted as compounds of various types.

item.title: Pkwak
item.description: Pkwak is a [[notes/Sakrat languages|Sakrat language]] spoken on the northern coast of [[notes/Continent A|Continent A]]. History Pkwak emerged out of a cluster of Sakrat B languages spoken by migrants to the north coast of Continent A between 1000‚Äì500 BP, where they gradually displaced the [[Pre-Pkwak]] languages previously spoken in that region.

item.title: Proto-Sakrat
item.description: Proto-Sakrat is the reconstructed ancestor of the [[notes/Sakrat languages|Sakrat languages]].

item.title: Qal Languages
item.description: The Qal languages are a major language family spoken on the west coast of [[notes/Continent E|Continent E]] and the southeastern coast of [[notes/Continent B|Continent B]].

item.title: Qa√±a
item.description: The qa√±a ([[Proto-Pre-Pkwak]] *qa…≤a) is a mammal which gives wool and milk like an alpaca. The qa√±a is native to [[notes/Continent A|Continent A]].

item.title: Sakrat languages
item.description: The Sakrat languages are a major language family. History To 1500 BP The ancestor of the Sakrat languages, [[notes/Proto-Sakrat|Proto-Sakrat]], was spoken around 2300 BP in the southern tip of [[notes/Continent D|Continent D]].

item.title: Sasyut
item.description: Sasyut is a [[notes/Sakrat languages|Sakrat language]].

item.title: Selal Sela
item.description: Selal Sela is a creole language formed out of the contact between speakers of [[notes/Kra Nzlor|Kra Nzlor]] and [[notes/Lenethailef|Lenethailef]].

item.title: Tarunian exchange
item.description: The Tarunian exchange was a event in which plants, animals, diseases were transferred between Continents [[notes/Continent B|B]]-[[notes/Continent E|E]], on the one hand, and [[notes/Continent A|A]]-[[notes/Continent C|C]]-[[notes/Continent D|D]], on the other.

item.title: When you cross the river
item.description: When you cross the river is a poem, originally written in [[notes/My«ênh|My«ênh]], but later translated to many other languages, including [[notes/Lenethailef|Lenethailef]].

item.title: Xangi
item.description: The xangi ([[Proto-Pre-Pkwak]] *xa≈ãi) is a large mammal used as a beast of burden like a camel. The xangi is native to [[notes/Continent A|Continent A]].
